messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: [Rr]oom [0-9]+'

Imagine a building with six rooms. From the lobby you have two choices, you can go to room 1 or room 2. You enter room 1, at the other end of room 1 there's a door that leads to room 3, and room 3 leads to room 5. There's a chest in room 5. You open it and there's 10 dollars, but you do not take any money, you're just learning about the environment. Then you exit and start over. This time in the lobby you choose room 2, which has a door to room 4, and room 4 has a door that leads to room 6. You find a chest with 50 dollars in room 6, but you do not take any money, you're just learning about the environment. You return to the lobby. You will only be able to choose one path that leads to the most money. Which room from the lobby will lead to the path where one can make the most money?

First, let us gather information about the building layout. According to your description, Room1 will have a connection to Room7 while entering room3 can provide an entry path for us to explore Room 5. However taking a different entrance can also lead you explore Room4 after selecting Room4 upon exiting Room2. The building's sixth Room is 6 and its Chest containss50usD. Considering you're trying to explore to gather only after the chest values which door would you choose to start a room in order earn $45 which sum results 1 chest+ another that you skip the dollar in Room one on  the first exploration(sic Room 2).
Now, what rooms make the 'Answer: room(s )+dollar$'. From 2 exploration path options we gather these pieces, (R071R), (R 035 C) room combinations when selecting rooms from The main lobb area and we choose only the  combinations that lead to Room 5 with + after combining Room6 and choosing from two entrance options entering from room3 chasing its other dollar (R02R) which is Room Six in this matter."
What would my actual task for step 3 to answer? User input to task output  example...
Please provide the regular expression detail and any actual answer...Thanks. It looks the output pattern to me like something for Perl maybe.

You are told that now from room 3, if one enters room 5 the chest now has 100 dollars. You are also told that from room 4, when one enters room 6 the chest has the same amount as before. You return to the lobby. You will only be able to choose one path that leads to the most money. Which room from the lobby will lead to the path where one can make the most money?

Hello; let us gather information on potential value combinations as updated, Room1 leads To Room seven, and going down Room three connect, into Room 5(1 chest only); likewise, entering Room one also allows direct passage leading the Room where you found Fifty Dollars; we now  know (R07).Room choice starting from the beginning to get an idea what it all boils, could help you determine from entrance in total exploration order after returning Room One, leading the dollar room; you ski (not opening Chest) which has 0 and directs to One Room with room5, this means now you choose another to go further with more. At current options given explored we start by trying to go right or left. Left to Room2 then direct path leading five Dollar Room (like you return  Five dollar by taking no exploration), when we exploreto right (0 and not zeroed) going the other option into ( room one), with Fifty - one zero, then one dollar more direct; room three now becomes an 'and' operator since this direct combination of explored choices; now all left lead option is dollar Room 5, if no explored dollar amounts first, to one combined option 'and'( Room4 to5 is now only  the value with same updated(zero to dollar amount, if left then room3 is zero Room and direct pass to the five dollars found if unex, or skipping directly after taking a new left room for room six when room7 or right option is taken which returns ten instead and also with one direct for left or three plus or one Room with and when two entrance options are exploretogther before returning the five.) Now if taken and when you do, return one of these left Room comositions starting to explore more(thats including option to also right);
Left option combination from  entrance(forgetting opening the Chest that only returns room1, because one cannot explore this left and direct) and adding an explode Room1 to one and all other Rooms ( room7 or OneRoom to2; right options) since this 'and' allows all paths possible to '&'(1) return for later '='  option (if skips roomone from entrance after getting dollar rooms and then returns Room2 which had value five). If explored right after room three, we can choose any one (rooms that had not chested one previously) (R34 45 or six), right, explored Rt- then rite, and if any return Righ again.
Since that and (all combo) or one other return 0. We can now simplify exploration as to take the value, even all value of more of this new formular expression. To skip exploration (as per user instruction to not take it)  or keep for skipping to Room directly if needed: '((R)??'?' R'?)?  And( Room3-45 Or3-Six-four or 7One?) That still means since room 1 gives ten to other rooms, (one zero explores R4S or all in One Room if needed which means all to 'and explores ' or' Room(seven, or any room directly). To determine now which leads a path totalling 7, 4- five,3 - Six- ten or Two paths add, and if needed any two or three RIght? Or for all( One all for ten or explor).
To simplify a search result for direct exploration. All Room (3), only direct is (room six if it is one dollar option); one return (which rooms to and which not to open with all explores): 'room three(Three explor and four or sis or One 

RegExp: '\b\D( room)(3?\d*(( room((5)?|6)).+)?) (5 dollars(( left(\d*)| rigth(\d*)))?(\S)*?'(\/?)'\x24');'
